newsitem.title: USA: Ill. Governor signs welfare reform bill.
newsitem.headline: Ill. Governor signs welfare reform bill.

text.p: Illinois Gov. Jim Edgar has signed welfare reform legislation approved during the last session to bring the state into line with federal requirements.

The new laws signed Thursday by Edgar create a temporary assistance program to replace Aid to Families with Dependent Children on July 1 and include a five-year limit on cash assistance that also requires families to find work after two years of aid.
Edgar has also increased state aid to a child care services program from $280 million to $380 million this year.
The entire effort will be coordinated by the state Department of Human Resources.
